availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hezekiah A. Procter (Simpson County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Hezekiah P. Procter and Catherine Procter. Student in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Laborer in Simpson County in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from December 10, 1861, to October 16, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 50B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 877.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 18.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 214-5.
Find A Grave, "Hezekiah Artemus "Hardy" Procter (1840-1900)," Memorial #44709827, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44709827 (accessed September 4, 2020).
